titleInfo.title: Photomontage of a World War I memorial, Sino-Soviet war scenes, a Lincoln County school, advertisements, an actress, a map, and bridge over the Cumberland River. Nashville Tennessean, 1929 September 1.

mods.abstract: Photomontage showing the Lafayette Escadrille memorial near St. Cloud, France, two Manchurian scenes during the Sino-Soviet war, a newly-built high school in Lincoln County, Tennessee, a advertisement for a film entitled Our Modern Maidens, an advertisement for Plough's Soap, a picture of actress Lillian Gish, a map dated 499 A.D. unearthed in Palestine, and two images showing a bridge being built over the Cumberland River in Celina, Tennessee. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.

originInfo.publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Record has been transformed into MODS 3.5 from a Qualified Dublin Core record by the Digital Library of Tennessee, a service hub of the Digital Public Library of America, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/digitallibraryoftennessee/DLTN_XSLT. Metadata originally created in a locally modified version of Qualified Dublin Core using ContentDM (data dictionary available: https://wiki.lib.utk.edu/display/DPLA).
